alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 4:20PM MST until June 26 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 715 PM MST. * At 414 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the area east of Interstate 17 in southeast Yavapai County. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, with floodwaters flowing toward Black Canyon City. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Black Canyon City and Horseshoe Reservoir. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Sycamore Creek, Dry Creek, Tangle Creek, Ash Creek, Black Canyon Creek, Copper Creek, South Fork Mud Spring Creek, Ash Spring Creek, Little Ash Creek, Mud Spring Creek, East Branch Squaw Creek, Indian Creek, Black Canyon, Agua Fria River, Verde River, Cienega Creek, Professor Creek, Houston Creek, New River and Red Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
